time_segmentation(sig, fs, nperseg=2048, noverlap=None, is_ecma=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function used for the segmentation of a time signal into smaller parts of audio (blocks).

Parameters:

  • sig (numpy.array) ‚Äì A 1-dimensional time signal array.

  • fs (float) ‚Äì The time signal sampling frequency.

  • nperseg (int, optional) ‚Äì Length of each segment. Defaults to 2048.

  • noverlap (int, optional) ‚Äì Number of points to overlap between segments. If None, noverlap = nperseg / 2. Defaults to None.

  • is_ecma (bool, optional) ‚Äì If is_ecma = True, the implementation is as described in Formula 16 (section 5.1.4) of ECMA-418-2. Defaults to False.

Returns:

  • block_array (numpy.array) ‚Äì A 2-dimensional array of size (nperseg, nseg) containing the segmented signal.

  • time (numpy.array) ‚Äì The time axis corresponding to the segmented signal, size (nseg,)
